page.title: 13CHESTER MOOR
page.content: Chester Moor,a village of 350 inhabitants to the south of Chester-le -Street,once had two collieries but the last closed in 1961.Since then things have changed and now there is no shop or post office.Some of the miners' houses have been demolished. Chester Moor has 130 employed people, 100 are retired and 50 are children which leaves 70 unemployed.50 households have cars and there are 90 pets.Most families have telephones and go to Chester-le-Street market on Tuesdays and Fridays. Interesting opinions about the village were "full of good neighbours","a happy mix of country and town","there are no shops" and "dirty dogs foul the pavement."
